[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ESPC supports data collection, analysis, and dissemination for weather and climate research.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ESPC integrates with satellite data sources, ground processing stations, and user portals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ESPC provides web-based dashboards for data visualization and management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ESPC interacts with geospatial software and data visualization tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ESPC supports secure data transmission via satellite and network protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ESPC is optimized for handling large datasets in real-time.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ESPC handles data acquisition, processing, and dissemination.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ESPC is configurable for diverse satellite data processing needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ESPC works with external analytics and data-sharing platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 MISSING-TAG2: ESPC runs on high-performance servers with redundant storage systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ESPC processes satellite data, generates analytical reports, and enables real-time data visualization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ESPC is designed for meteorologists, environmental scientists, and data analysts with moderate technical expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ESPC is dependent on satellite connectivity and ground station compatibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ESPC requires secure data channels, robust processing infrastructure, and user authentication mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Environmental Data: Satellite-derived data for weather analysis.
Data Processing: Converts raw data into usable formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 MISSING-TAG1: The Environmental Satellite Processing Center (ESPC) document defines requirements for accurate and reliable satellite data processing.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with satellite ground stations for real-time data acquisition.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The GUI shall provide data visualization and management tools for end-users.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall process raw satellite data into geospatial formats (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate analytical reports based on user-defined parameters (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall disseminate processed data to external platforms (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The GUI shall provide intuitive navigation and customizable views for data management.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store processed data for a minimum of 5 years.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall provide secure data backup and recovery mechanisms.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular design principles for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with international geospatial data standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime during operational hours.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall provide feedback within 2 seconds for user actions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 1TB of satellite data within 30 minutes.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support concurrent access by 500 users without degradation.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate data processing workflows, system reliability, and GUI responsiveness.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Technical manuals, API documentation, and configurations.
[SEC] 5. References: ESPC Technical Manual, International Geospatial Standards, and Satellite Data Guidelines.
